name: ABE VR
description: ABE VR is an intense experience that recreates the horrifying story about a misguided robot seeking the unconditional love of humans…at whatever cost.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 64-bit or newer Processor: Intel Core i5 4590 or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon R9 290 or better Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: A short 8 minute experience, creepy and well worth trying without being traumatisingly scary. Light philosophical horror in a seated experience.

While short and not really scary enough, it tells an interesting story (though short and simple), and it's a free game for VR that does the job it set out to do.The best part of the experience for me was definitely how well they portrayed ABE, the psycho killer robot. His cold expressionless face and rigid movements definitely made me feel like I was being studied by some calculating machine, while also giving him enough character to be interesting.   You won't be blown away but I can't think of one reason not to get this.
Like written many times before a good and short experience. But it´s something different and I want to thanks the devs for producing and offering it for free.
Good little short video, not much more to it than that. No interaction, abe on the run could be good as a game.

I look at this as just like one of the old short cartoons. It's nothing fancy, but worth a few minutes if you are short on content to keep you occupied while you wait for your wallet to recover from purchasing VR.
Creepy as ♥♥♥♥.  Also doubles as an excellent prank if you have someone lay down to 'try this new game'
intense, worth the 10 mins and plus scared the crap out of my mates

What can I say its free.  However, it just didnt seem immersive enough for me. I felt like ive seen this before. Dont get me wrong I recommend anyone with VR to try it.  Its not as overwhelming as people say but worth the ticket of admission.

Decided to play this before watching the original short it was based on. (The short has a little more at the end though)  Quite an interesting 'story', filled with some questions on what is to be human and the nature of emotions, though requires someone to want to explore these concepts in afterthought rather than being spoonfed during the experience.  And really, it's just an experience, you are 'seated' in one place and it plays out.  Can only really reccommend it if you're into the whole sci-fi horror genre, but hey, it's free!
It's intresting but very short and free.

This experience would have been better suited for release as a 180° stereoscopic video.  It really ruins the immersion that you can't move your head, only turn it.  It could have saved the experience if e.g. you were able to pull your head away when the robot comes close, with his movements compensating to match your movement.  As it is, all animations are completely static, including the very unrealistic moth that doesn't appear to be obeying the law of gravity as it flies about the room.
Clichéd rogue robot story. Short and sadly not engaging. I never felt threatened, so the whole experience was pretty pointless for me.

I was really hyped for this game. I really like how it started, but the ending was sooooo terrible. A stock-audio scream and blood splatters on the screen...   It could have been scarier if you saw the robot slowly cutting into your arm. That would have made it very unnerving and would be very weird once you noticed it wasn't your arm they are cutting into XD Barely a horror game...  It's free, and you can play it. But I don't think it's really good.
This is a waste of your time, do not download! Credits are longer then the film itself....

I mean, the main argument for this is 'it's free, so you should try it!' - so if that doesnt say anything to you...  I finally tried this game a few weeks after downloading it (I downloaded several VR games for the SO and friends to play, this one they did not make it to) and after trying myself, I immediately had to check if I paid anything for it or not; I am glad I didn't.  I don't feel this offered anything that other 'free VR games' do and honestly, I felt as if I wasted 10 minutes of my time. It did not instil fear, the monoluge did not make me interested in any way; if this is based on a short film then should it not make me interested in seeing said film.  Overall, while yes it is free, I still don't find the time spent playing it worth playing it at all.
